parse.title: Skoblin
parse.text:
For other uses, see Skeleton (disambiguation).
This article is about the skoblins under Lumbridge. For the ones in the Goblin Temple, see Skoblin (Strongbones).
Skoblin

Skoblins can be found in the ninth room of the Lumbridge Catacombs, which can only be entered after completing The Blood Pact quest. They were created by now undead Dragith Nurn the necromancer, during his experiments with local creatures.

This is one of the monsters that drop Mask part 4, which can be used with the 4 other parts to create the Mask of Dragith Nurn.

As these are skeletal goblins, they count as both skeleton and goblin Slayer assignment; however, for champion scrolls only the Skeleton Champion's scroll can be dropped by them. An ushabti will capture a goblin soul when killing skoblins.

Tertiary drops[edit | edit source]

These drops are dropped alongside main drops.

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Mask part 4[1]1Uncommon11
Chargebow[2]1Uncommon2,886Not alchemisable
Skeleton Champion's scroll[3]11/5,00011
  1. ^ Not dropped if you already have one, or a Mask of Dragith Nurn, in your possession.
  2. ^ Only dropped if you do not possess one in either your inventory or bank.
  3. ^ Although this creature is both a skeleton and a goblin, it only drops the skeleton scroll.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
  • patch 5 July 2010 (Update):
    • The new skeletons and goblins in the Lumbridge Catacombs can now also drop champion scrolls.
  • update 15 March 2010 (Update):
    • Added to the game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The word "skoblin" is a portmanteau of skeleton and goblin.
